head.supplied: 23/5/93 ¶ ¶ Let me express my best thanks, dear Mons Autran, to Mr Barbey and yourself, for having sent me the commencement of the new periodic publications, emanating from the collections of Boissie...

div.p:
Let me express my best thanks, dear Mons Autran, to Mr Barbey and yourself, for having sent me the commencement of the new periodic publications, emanating from the collections of Boissier.
Bulletin de l'Herbier Boissier. This promises to be a most important Serial, and one also of perpetuity. I will forward from time to time publications of mine, as they appear, also small packages of dried plants, so far as they can be sent by post. I will endeavour also to send former works of mine, as opportunities arise.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
What a loss that of the great Alph. de Candolle! I gave on the 8th May an oration in his memory at the Victorian Field-Naturalists-Club, of which I am Patron.
B93.06.04. Alphonse de Candolle died on 4 April 1893. He wrote after nearly 40 years correspondence a most touching letter only to me two weeks before his death.
A. de Candolle to M, 17 March 1893.

It will afford me particular pleasure, to contribute occasionally to the Bulletin of the Herbier de Boissier. I can do so in the French language, but can write more fluently and quickly in English, German and Latin.
